element.name: a
element.description: Defines the properties for a link or a target.

browser.description: IE 5-6 only supports :hover on links.

element.example:
This example shows a set styles of anchor elements that will visually change color and text-decoration depending on state and mouse behavior:


a {
	color: blue;
	text-decoration: underline;
}

a:active {
	color: yellow;
	text-decoration: none;
}

a:link {
	color: blue;
	text-decoration: underline;
}

a:visited {
	color: purple;
	text-decoration: none;
}

a:focus {
	color: red;
	text-decoration: none;
}

a:hover {
	color: red;
	text-decoration: none;
}
element.remarks: Combine different anchor styles to create visual cues for your links.

element.name: a:active
element.description: Defines the properties for an active link.
element.example:
This example shows a set styles of anchor elements that will visually change color and text-decoration depending on state and mouse behavior:


a {
	color: blue;
	text-decoration: underline;
}

a:active {
	color: yellow;
	text-decoration: none;
}

a:link {
	color: blue;
	text-decoration: underline;
}

a:visited {
	color: purple;
	text-decoration: none;
}

a:focus {
	color: red;
	text-decoration: none;
}

a:hover {
	color: red;
	text-decoration: none;
}
element.remarks: A link becomes "active" for the moment when a user is clicking the link. Takes the same properties as a regular anchor element. You can style an a:active element to show a visual cue as to when the link is active.

element.name: a:focus
element.description: Defines the properties for a link that currently has focus.
element.example:
This example shows a set styles of anchor elements that will visually change color and text-decoration depending on state and mouse behavior:


a {
	color: blue;
	text-decoration: underline;
}

a:active {
	color: yellow;
	text-decoration: none;
}

a:link {
	color: blue;
	text-decoration: underline;
}

a:visited {
	color: purple;
	text-decoration: none;
}

a:focus {
	color: red;
	text-decoration: none;
}

a:hover {
	color: red;
	text-decoration: none;
}
element.remarks: Takes the same properties as a regular anchor element. You can style an a:focus element to show a visual cue as to when the link has focus.

element.name: a:hover
element.description: Defines the properties for a link that a user is currently hovering over with the mouse.
element.example:
This example shows a set styles of anchor elements that will visually change color and text-decoration depending on state and mouse behavior:


a {
	color: blue;
	text-decoration: underline;
}

a:active {
	color: yellow;
	text-decoration: none;
}

a:link {
	color: blue;
	text-decoration: underline;
}

a:visited {
	color: purple;
	text-decoration: none;
}

a:focus {
	color: red;
	text-decoration: none;
}

a:hover {
	color: red;
	text-decoration: none;
}
element.remarks: Takes the same properties as a regular anchor element. You can style an a:hover element to show a visual cue as to when a user is hovering over the link. Use a:hover to easily mimic rollover behavior for your links.

element.name: a:link
element.description: Defines the properties for an unvisited link.
element.remarks: Takes the same properties as a regular anchor element. You can style an a:link element to show that the link has not yet been clicked.
element.example:
This example shows a set styles of anchor elements that will visually change color and text-decoration depending on state and mouse behavior:


a {
	color: blue;
	text-decoration: underline;
}

a:active {
	color: yellow;
	text-decoration: none;
}

a:link {
	color: blue;
	text-decoration: underline;
}

a:visited {
	color: purple;
	text-decoration: none;
}

a:focus {
	color: red;
	text-decoration: none;
}

a:hover {
	color: red;
	text-decoration: none;
}

element.name: a:visited
element.description: Defines the properties for a visited link.
element.example:
This example shows a set styles of anchor elements that will visually change color and text-decoration depending on state and mouse behavior:


a {
	color: blue;
	text-decoration: underline;
}

a:active {
	color: yellow;
	text-decoration: none;
}

a:link {
	color: blue;
	text-decoration: underline;
}

a:visited {
	color: purple;
	text-decoration: none;
}

a:focus {
	color: red;
	text-decoration: none;
}

a:hover {
	color: red;
	text-decoration: none;
}
element.remarks: Takes the same properties as a regular anchor element. You can style an a:visited element differently to show a visual cue as to when the link has already been visited.

element.name: b
element.description: Defines the properties for bold text.
element.example:
This example styles a "b" element to have its font-weight be "bolder" than the default boldface font:


b {
	font-weight:bolder;
}
element.remarks: You will not usually need to style a "b" element unless you want bold text rendered differently than the default bold face style.

element.name: blockquote
element.description: Defines the properties for a blockquote.
element.example:
This example adds padding around a blockquote and sets the left margin at 10px:


blockquote {
	margin-left: 10px;
	padding: 5px;
}
element.remarks: Common style settings for blockquote elements include changes to margins and padding.

element.name: body
element.description: Defines the properties for the document Body.
element.example:
This example sets the default font and background image as a vertically repeating gif image for the body of a document:


body {
	font-family:Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
	background-image: url(images/nachos.gif);
	background-repeat:repeat-y;
}
element.remarks: Common style settings for blockquote elements include changes to margins and padding.

element.name: code
element.description: Defines the properties for a block of text formatted as code.
element.example:
This example sets the font for code elements to the Courier font family and decreases the font size by one:


code {
	font-family:"Courier New", Courier, monospace;
	font-size: smaller;
}
element.remarks: The standard font for code samples is courier or another similar monospace font.

element.name: div
element.description: Defines the properties for a pre-defined content block in a document.
element.example:
This example colors the background for all divs yellow and gives them a red font:


div {
	background-color: yellow;
	color: red;
}
element.remarks: Usually, you will assign a class or id to a div to style it, rather than styling all divs.

element.name: em
element.description: Defines the properties for a block of text block of text that is formatted for emphasis.
element.example:
This sets the font for em elements to italic:


em {
	font-style:italic;
}
element.remarks: Usually, em elements should be rendered in italics.

element.name: fieldset
element.description: Defines a set of related form controls to be grouped together.
element.example:
This example places a border around a fieldset:


fieldset {
	border-color: navy;
	border-style: double;
	border-width: thin;
}
element.remarks: Use <fieldset> </fieldset> tags to group form controls together for usability and tabbing.

element.name: form
element.description: Defines the properties for a form.
element.example:
This example places a border around all form elements and sets the default font for any text in a form:


form {
	border-color: navy;
	border-style: double;
	border-width: thin;
	font-family:"Times New Roman", Times, serif;
}
element.remarks: You can also use divs and tables to help style your forms.

element.name: h1
element.description: Defines the properties for a Heading 1 element.
element.example:
This example styles an h1 element:


h1 {
	font-family: Verdana, Geneva, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
	font-size: 24pt;
	color: navy;
	padding-top: 12px;
	padding-bottom: 3px;
}
element.remarks: You can specify different amounts of padding above and below a heading to group it visually with other elements.

element.name: h2
element.description: Defines the properties for a Heading 2 element.
element.example:
This example styles an h2 element:


h2 {
	font-family: Verdana, Geneva, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
	font-size: 20pt;
	color: navy;
	padding-top: 12px;
	padding-bottom: 3px;
}
element.remarks: You can specify different amounts of padding above and below a heading to group it visually with other elements.

element.name: h3
element.description: Defines the properties for a Heading 3 element.
element.example:
This example styles an h3 element:


h3 {
	font-family: Verdana, Geneva, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
	font-size: 18pt;
	color: navy;
	padding-top: 10px;
	padding-bottom: 3px;
}
element.remarks: You can specify different amounts of padding above and below a heading to group it visually with other elements.

element.name: h4
element.description: Defines the properties for a Heading 4 element.
element.example:
This example styles an h4 element:


h4 {
	font-family: Verdana, Geneva, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
	font-size: 14pt;
	color: navy;
	padding-top: 6px;
	padding-bottom: 0px;
}
element.remarks: You can specify different amounts of padding above and below a heading to group it visually with other elements.

element.name: h5
element.description: Defines the properties for a Heading 5 element.
element.example:
This example styles an h5 element:


h5 {
	font-family: Verdana, Geneva, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
	font-size: 12pt;
	color: black;
	padding-top: 3px;
	padding-bottom: 0px;
}
element.remarks: You can specify different amounts of padding above and below a heading to group it visually with other elements.

element.name: h6
element.description: Defines the properties for a Heading 6 element.
element.example:
This example styles an h6 element:


h6 {
	font-family: Verdana, Geneva, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
	font-size: 10pt;
	font-weight: bold;
	color: black;
}
element.remarks: You can specify different amounts of padding above and below a heading to group it visually with other elements.

element.name: hr
element.description: Defines the properties for a horizontal rule.
element.example:
This example styles an hr element:


hr {
	color: red;
	padding-top: 10px;
	padding-bottom: 10px;
}
element.remarks: You can use CSS styles to change things such as the the color and amount of padding around a horizontal rule.

element.name: i
element.description: Defines the properties for a block of text formatted as italics.
element.example:
This example adds an underline to all text enclosed by the "i" element:


i {
	text-decoration: underline;
}
element.remarks: You will not usually need to style the "i" element differently than its default settings.

element.name: input
element.description: Defines the properties for an input field on a form.
element.example:
This example adds a border and padding around all input elements:


input {
	border-color: black;
	border-style: solid;
	border-width: thin;
	padding: 3px;
}
element.remarks: You will usually use classes and id's to style individual input elements, rather than styling all input elements at once.

element.name: label
element.description: Defines a label on a form.
element.example:
This example adds a border and padding around a form label:


label {
	border-color: black;
	border-style: solid;
	border-width: thin;
	padding: 3px;
}
element.remarks: In addition to <fieldset> </fieldset>, <label> </label>, and <legend> </legend> elements, you can use <table> </table> and <div> </div> elements to improve the layout of a form.

element.name: legend
element.description: Defines a legend for the fields on a form.
element.example:
This example adds a border and padding around a form legend:


legend {
	border-color: black;
	border-style: solid;
	border-width: thin;
	padding: 3px;
}
element.remarks: In addition to <fieldset> </fieldset>, <label> </label>, and <legend> </legend> elements, you can use <table> </table> and <div> </div> elements to improve the layout of a form.

element.name: li
element.description: Defines the properties for an item in a list.
element.example:
This example sets the style for all list items to "square":


li {
	list-style-type:square;
}
element.remarks: Style rules for "li" elements will apply to elements in both ordered and unordered lists.

element.name: ol
element.description: Defines the properties for an ordered list.
element.example:
This example sets the style for all ordered lists to lower-case alphabet characters:


li {
	list-style-type: lower-alpha;
}
element.remarks: Style rules for "li" elements will apply to elements in both ordered and unordered lists. Use "ol" and "ul" styles to set the styles for the two list types separately.

element.name: optgroup
element.description: Specifies a grouping of option elements within a select element.
element.example:
This example places a border around an optgroup:


optgroup {
	border-color: navy;
	border-style: double;
	border-width: thin;
}
element.remarks: <optgroup></optgroup> tags should always be nested within a <select></select> element.

element.name: option
element.description: Specifies an option in a select (selection list) element.
element.example:
This example places a border around an option:


option {
	border-color: navy;
	border-style: double;
	border-width: thin;
}
element.remarks: <option></option> tags should always be nested within a <select></select> element.

element.name: p
element.description: Defines the properties for a paragraph element.
element.example:
This example sets the font family and size for paragraph text and adds padding to bottom of a paragraph:


p {
	font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
	font-size: 10pt;
	padding-bottom: 3px;
}
element.remarks: Setting the font characteristics for your "p" elements will also set those characteristics for elements such as "b", and "i" that will inherit attributes such as "font-family" from the parent "p" tag.

element.name: pre
element.description: Defines the properties for a block of preformatted text.
element.example:
This example sets the font for preformatted elements to the Courier font family and decreases the font size by one:


pre {
	font-family:"Courier New", Courier, monospace;
	font-size: smaller;
}
element.remarks: Since the "pre" tag is often used to designate code samples, you will often set the font for preformatted text to courier or another similar monospace font.

element.name: small
element.description: Defines the properties for a block of text one font size smaller than the base font.
element.example:
This example sets the font for "small" text to a fixed size of 8pt:


small {
	font-size: 8pt;
}
element.remarks: By default, "small" sets the size of a font to one size smaller relative to the parent element.

element.name: span
element.description: Defines the properties for a pre-defined text span element.
element.example:
This example sets the background color for all span elements to red:


span {
	background-color: red;
}
element.remarks: You will usually style individual span elements by assigning classes and id's to them and styling those. Assigning the same styles to all span elements usually is not very useful.

element.name: strong
element.description: Defines the properties for a block of text formatted as "strong."
element.example:
This example sets the font-weight for all "strong" elements to "bolder", which is darker than the standard "bold":


strong {
	font-weight: bolder;
}
element.remarks: You will usually style individual span elements by assigning classes and id's to them and styling those. Assigning the same styles to all span elements usually is not very useful.

element.name: table
element.description: Defines the properties for a table.
element.example:
This example specifies that all tables should have top and bottom borders, but no left or right borders. It also sets the font-size to one size smaller than the parent element text:


table {
	border-bottom: navy solid thin;
	border-top: navy solid thin;
	border-left: none;
	border-right: none;
	font-size: smaller;
}
element.remarks: When you style table elements, you will usually be setting things like border styles and padding.

element.name: td
element.description: Defines the properties for an individual table cell.
element.example:
This example specifies that all table cells should have top and bottom borders, but no left or right borders. It also sets the font-size to one size smaller than the parent element text:


td {
	border-bottom: navy solid thin;
	border-top: navy solid thin;
	border-left: none;
	border-right: none;
	font-size: smaller;
}
element.remarks: Because table cells are children of "table" and "tr" elements, they will inherit some of their styles from those elements.

element.name: textarea
element.description: Defines the properties for a textarea input field on a form.
element.example:
This example adds a border and padding around all textarea elements:


textarea {
	border-color: black;
	border-style: solid;
	border-width: thin;
	padding: 3px;
}
element.remarks: You will usually use classes and id's to style individual textarea elements, rather than styling all textarea elements at once.

element.name: th
element.description: Defines the properties for a table header cell.
element.example:
This example specifies that all table header cells should have top and bottom borders, but no left or right borders. It also sets the font-size to one size smaller than the parent element text:


th {
	border-bottom: navy solid thin;
	border-top: navy solid thin;
	border-left: none;
	border-right: none;
	font-size: smaller;
}
element.remarks: Because table header cells are children of "table" and "tr" elements, they will inherit some of their styles from those elements.

element.name: tr
element.description: Defines the properties for a table row.
element.example:
This example specifies that all table rows should have top and bottom borders, but no left or right borders. It also sets the font-size to one size smaller than the parent element text:


tr {
	border-bottom: navy solid thin;
	border-top: navy solid thin;
	border-left: none;
	border-right: none;
	font-size: smaller;
}
element.remarks: Because table rows are children of "table" elements, they will inherit some of their styles from those elements.

element.name: ul
element.description: Defines the properties for an unordered list.
element.example:
This example sets the style for all unordered lists to "square":


li {
	list-style-type: square;
}
element.remarks: Style rules for "li" elements will apply to elements in both ordered and unordered lists. Use "ol" and "ul" styles to set the styles for the two list types separately.

field.name: accelerator
field.description: Specifies whether or not the element has an accelerator key, which is a shortcut for selecting the element.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: true
value.description: Background image scrolls with the document.

value.name: false
value.description: Background image is fixed as the document scrolls.

field.name: azimuth
field.description: Specifies the speaker balance for audio content.

value.description: Specify a value for azimuth that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

field.remarks: To specify an angle, use syntax similar to "90deg".

field.name: background
field.description: Defines the background properties for an element.

value.description: Specify a value for background that is not on this list.

value.name: #ffffff
value.description: background-color: Background color placeholder. e.g. #ffffff = white

value.name: inherit
value.description: background-attachment: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: scroll
value.description: background-attachment:Background image scrolls with the document.

value.name: fixed
value.description: background-attachment:Background image is fixed as the document scrolls.

value.name: top
value.description: background-position: Top of the parent element or window.

value.name: center
value.description: background-position: Center of the parent element or window.

value.name: bottom
value.description: background-position: Bottom of the parent element or window.

value.name: left
value.description: background-position: Left edge of the parent element or window.

value.name: right
value.description: background-position: Right edge of the parent element or window.

value.name: repeat
value.description: background-repeat: Image repeats both horizontally and vertically.

field.remarks: Use the background property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual background properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a background- property as part of background.
field.example: To specify a background image in an "images" directory named myCat.jpg that repeats vertically, use the following syntax: body {background: url(images/myCat.jpg), repeat-y}.

field.name: background-attachment
field.description: Specifies whether or not the background image is fixed or scrollable as a user scrolls the document.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: scroll
value.description: Background image scrolls with the document.

value.name: fixed
value.description: Background image is fixed as the document scrolls.

browser.description: IE uses the value "local" instead of "scroll".

field.example:
For additional information and a demonstration of the background-attachment attribute, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/background.html

field.name: background-color
field.description: Specifies the background color for the element. Specify either a color name or RGB color code.
field.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.
field.example:
For additional information and a demonstration of the background-color attribute, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/columns.html#background

field.name: background-image
field.description: Specifies the URL for a background image for an element.
field.example: To specify a background image in an "images" directory named myCat.jpg, use the following syntax: body {background-image: url(images/myCat.jpg)}.

field.name: background-position
field.description: Specifies the position of a background image for an element.

value.description: Specify a value for background-position not on this list.

value.name: top
value.description: Top of the parent element or window.

value.name: center
value.description: Center of the parent element or window.

value.name: bottom
value.description: Bottom of the parent element or window.

value.name: left
value.description: Left edge of the parent element or window.

value.name: right
value.description: Right edge of the parent element or window.

field.remarks: If you do not specify one or more of the values top, center, bottom, left, or right, you can also specify pixel values (px), percentage values (%), em, in, cm, mm, pt, and pc.

field.name: background-position-x
field.description: Specifies the x-position of a background image for an element.
field.hint: [length | percentage | horziontal-alignment]. Example values: 50px 50px, 10% 5%, 2cm 4cm, 2cm 5%, center, etc.

value.description: Specify a value for background-position-x not on this list.

value.name: center
value.description: Center of the parent element or window.

value.name: left
value.description: Left edge of the parent element or window.

value.name: right
value.description: Right edge of the parent element or window.

field.name: background-position-y
field.description: Specifies the y-position of a background image for an element.
field.hint: [length | percentage | vertical-alignment]. Example values: 50px 50px, 10% 5%, 2cm 4cm, 2cm 5%, center, etc.

value.description: Specify a value for background-position not on this list.

value.name: top
value.description: Top of the parent element or window.

value.name: center
value.description: Center of the parent element or window.

value.name: bottom
value.description: Bottom of the parent element or window.

field.name: background-repeat
field.description: Specifies how a background image repeats for an element.

value.name: repeat
value.description: Image repeats both horizontally and vertically.

field.name: border
field.description: Defines the border properties for an element.

value.description: Specify a border value not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: #ffffff
value.description: border-color: Border color placeholder. e.g. #ffffff = white

browser.description: IE does not support borders on table columns.

field.remarks: Use the border property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual border properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a border- property as part of border.
field.example:
To specify a thick, red, dashed border, use the following syntax: .myborderclass {border: thick red dashed;}.

For additional information and a demonstration of the border attribute, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/columns.html#border

field.name: border-bottom
field.description: Defines the properties for the bottom border for the element.

value.description: Specify a border-bottom value not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: #ffffff
value.description: border-bottom-color: Border color placeholder. e.g. #ffffff = white

field.remarks: Use the border-bottom property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual border-bottom properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a border-bottom- property as part of border-bottom.
field.example: To specify a thick, red, dashed bottom border, use the following syntax: .myborderbottomclass {border-bottom: thick red dashed;}.

field.name: border-bottom-color
field.description: Specifies the color for a bottom border. Specify either a color name or RGB color code.
field.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

field.name: border-bottom-style
field.description: Specifies a style for a bottom border.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

field.name: border-bottom-width
field.description: Specifies the width of the bottom border.

value.description: Specify a border width value not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

field.remarks: You can also specify a fixed pixel value for border-bottom-width.

field.name: border-collapse
field.description: Specifies whether the borders for an element are collapsed or separated.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

browser.description: In IE 5, 6, and 7, border-collapse: collapse does not overrule cellspacing.

field.example:
For a demonstration of the border-collapse attribute, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/tables.html#bordercollapse

field.name: border-color
field.description: Specifies the color for the borders for an element. Specify either a color name or RGB color code.
field.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

field.name: border-left
field.description: Defines the properties for the left border for the element.

value.description: Specify a border-left value not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: #ffffff
value.description: border-left-color: Border color placeholder. e.g. #ffffff = white

field.remarks: Use the border-left property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual border-left properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a border-left- property as part of border-left.
field.example: To specify a thick, red, dashed left border, use the following syntax: .myborderleftclass {border-left: thick red dashed;}.

field.name: border-left-color
field.description: Specifies the color for a left border. Specify either a color name or RGB color code.
field.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

field.name: border-left-style
field.description: Specifies a style for a left border.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

field.name: border-left-width
field.description: Specifies the width of the left border.

value.description: Specify a border width value not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

field.remarks: You can also specify a fixed pixel value for border-left-width.

field.name: border-right
field.description: Defines the properties for the right border for the element.

value.description: Specify a border-right value not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: #ffffff
value.description: border-right-color: Border color placeholder. e.g. #ffffff = white

field.remarks: Use the border-right property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual border-right properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a border-right- property as part of border-right.
field.example: To specify a thick, red, dashed right border, use the following syntax: .myborderrightclass {border-right: thick red dashed;}.

field.name: border-right-color
field.description: Specifies the color for a right border. Specify either a color name or RGB color code.
field.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

field.name: border-right-style
field.description: Specifies a style for a right border.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

field.name: border-right-width
field.description: Specifies the width of the right border.

value.description: Specify a border width value not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

field.remarks: You can also specify a fixed pixel value for border-right-width.

field.name: border-spacing
field.description: Specifies the number of pixels between the border and its contents.
field.remarks: To specify different values for horizontal and vertical spacing, specify two values with the horizontal value first.
field.example:
To specify 6px of space on the sides and 12px of spacing above and below and element, use the following syntax: .myborderclass {border-spacing: 6px 12px;}.

For a demonstration of the empty-cells attribute, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/tables.html#emptycells

field.name: border-style
field.description: Specifies a style for a border.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

field.remarks:
Use the border-style property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual border-style properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a border-style- property as part of border-style.

You can specify up to four different border styles for the border of an element.

  • For border that is the same on all four sides, specify a single value.
  • For border that is different on the top/bottom and left/right sides, specify two values with the top/bottom value first.
  • For border that is different on the top, left/right, and bottom sides, specify three values with the top value first, followed by the left/right and then bottom values.
  • For border with four different styles, specify four values in the order of top, right, bottom, and left.
field.example: To specify a border style that is solid on top, ridged on the right and bottom, and solid on the left, use the following syntax: .myborderclass {border-style: solid ridged ridged solid;}.

field.name: border-top
field.description: Defines the properties for the top border for the element.

value.description: Specify a border-top value not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: #ffffff
value.description: border-top-color: Border color placeholder. e.g. #ffffff = white

field.remarks: Use the border-top property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual border-top properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a border-top- property as part of border-top.
field.example: To specify a thick, red, dashed top border, use the following syntax: .mybordertopclass {border-top: thick red dashed;}.

field.name: border-top-color
field.description: Specifies the color for a top border. Specify either a color name or RGB color code.
field.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

field.name: border-top-style
field.description: Specifies a style for a top border.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

field.name: border-top-width
field.description: Specifies the width of the top border.

value.description: Specify a border width value not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

field.remarks: You can also specify a fixed pixel value for border-top-width.

field.name: border-width
field.description: Specifies the width of the border.

value.description: Specify a border width value not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

field.remarks:
You can also specify a fixed pixel value for border-width.

You can specify up to four different widths for the border of an element.

  • For border that is the same on all four sides, specify a single value.
  • For border that is different on the top/bottom and left/right sides, specify two values with the top/bottom value first.
  • For border that is different on the top, left/right, and bottom sides, specify three values with the top value first, followed by the left/right and then bottom values.
  • For border with four different styles, specify four values in the order of top, right, bottom, and left.
field.example: To specify a border width that is 2px on top, 1px on the right and bottom, and 2px on the left, use the following syntax: .myborderclass {border-width: 2px 1px 1px 2px;}.

field.name: bottom
field.description: Specifies the y-coordinate for the position of the element relative to the bottom edge of the parent element or browser window.

value.description: Specify a value for bottom that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Position as determined by window or parent element.

field.remarks: You can also specify a fixed pixel or percentage value for bottom.

field.name: caption-side
field.description: Specifies the position of a caption for the element.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: top
value.description: Position the caption at the top of the element.

value.name: bottom
value.description: Position the caption at the bottom of the element.

value.name: left
value.description: Position the caption at the left side of the element.

value.name: right
value.description: Position the caption at the right side of the element.

browser.description: Only Mozilla supports the values "left" and "right".

field.example:
For a demonstration of the caption-side attribute, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/tables.html#captionside

field.name: clear
field.description: Specifies the position of the element relative to a floating object on the page.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: left
value.description: Positions the element to the left of the object.

value.name: right
value.description: Positions the element to the right of the object.

value.name: both
value.description: Clear the object until the element can reach both margins.

field.name: clip
field.description: Specifies the x- and y-coordinates (in pixels) for the clipping rectangle around the element.
field.hint: [rect(top-value right-value bottom-value left-value)]. Example values: rect(10px 25px 25px 10px).

value.description: Specify a value for clip that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Position as determined by the window or parent element.

field.name: color
field.description: Specifies the color of the text for the element. Specify either a color name or RGB color code.
field.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

field.name: content
field.description: Specifies the content to insert before or after the element.
field.hint: [url(image-url) | quote-style-value]. Example values: url(images/bluestar.gif), "Chapter: ", open-quote, etc.

value.description: Specify a value for content that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: no-open-quote
value.description: Increment the nesting level of quotes, but do not insert quotes.

value.name: no-close-quote
value.description: Decrement the nesting level of quotes, but do not insert quotes.

field.remarks: Use content to specify either a quote style or an image to use (similar to a bullet) before or after an element.
field.example: To specify that a paragraph should have an image from an "images" directory called "bluestar.gif" before it use the following syntax: p:before {content: url(images/bluestar.gif);}.

field.name: counter-increment
field.description: Specifies a name of a counter and how much to increment the counter by.
field.hint: [counter-name] [increment]. Example values: countby2 2, chapter, countbackwards -1, etc.

value.description: Specify a value for counter-increment that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: decimal-leading-zero
value.description: Increment a decimal with a leading zero. (e.g. 01, 02, 03, etc.)

value.name: lower-roman
value.description: Increment lower-case roman numerals. (e.g. i, ii, iii, etc.

value.name: upper-roman
value.description: Increment upper-case roman numerals. (e.g. I, II, III.)

value.name: lower-latin
value.description: Increment lower-case latin alphabet. (e.g. a, b, c, etc.)

value.name: upper-latin
value.description: Increment upper-case latin alphabet. (e.g. A, B, C, etc.)

field.remarks: Use the counter-increment property for styles such as numbered headings.
field.example: To specify a level-1 section heading with an incremented Roman numeral before each heading, use the following syntax: H1:before {counter(section, upper-roman); counter-increment: section;}.

field.name: counter-reset
field.description: Resets a counter to the specified value.

value.description: Specify a value for counter-reset that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

field.example: To specify a level-1 section heading with an incremented Roman numeral before each heading and that sets a counter called "section" to "1" each time it occurs, use the following syntax: H1:before {counter(chapter, upper-roman); counter-increment: section; counter-reset section 1;}.

field.name: cue
field.description: Defines the properties for an aural cue before or after an element.
field.remarks: Use the cue property as a shortcut to typing out both the cue-before and cue-after properties separately.
field.example: To specify a sound file named "bell.wav" before an H1 element and a sound file named "horns.wav", use the following syntax: H1 {cue: url("bell.wav") url("horns.wav");}.

field.name: cue-after
field.description: Defines the properties for an aural cue after an element.
field.example: To specify a sound file named "horns.wav" after an H1 element, use the following syntax: H1 {cue: url("horns.wav");}.

field.name: cue-before
field.description: Defines the properties for an aural cue before an element.
field.example: To specify a sound file named "bell.wav" before an H1 element, use the following syntax: H1 {cue-before: url("bell.wav");}.

field.name: cursor
field.description: Specifies which cursor to display when a user mouses over the element.
field.hint: [cursor-value | url(cursor-url)]. Example values: url(mycursor.cur), hand, etc.

value.description: Specify a value for cursor that is not on this list. (Safari does not support custom cursors.)

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Cursor to be determined by browser or user settings.

value.name: text
value.description: I-bar cursor (Indicates text may be selected).

browser.description: Supports all W3C cursor values except for progress.

field.example:
For a demonstration of the curosor attribute, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/cursor.html

field.description: Specifies how to display the element.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: inline
value.description: Display the element as one or more inline boxes.

value.name: block
value.description: Display the element as a block box.

value.name: inline-block
value.description: Display the element as an inline block box.

value.name: list-item
value.description: Display the element as a block box and inline list item box.

value.name: run-in
value.description: Display an element as a block or inline box, depending on the context.

value.name: compact
value.description: Display an element as a block or inline box, depending on the context.

value.name: marker
value.description: Specifies that generated content before or after a box is a marker.

value.name: inline-table
value.description: Specifies that the element should be treated like a table element.

value.name: table-row-group
value.description: Specifies that the element should be treated like a table row group.

value.name: table-header-group
value.description: Specifies that the element should be treated like a table header group.

value.name: table-footer-group
value.description: Specifies that the element should be treated like a table footer group.

value.name: table-row
value.description: Specifies that the element should be treated like a table row.

value.name: table-column-group
value.description: Specifies that the element should be treated like a table column group.

value.name: table-column
value.description: Specifies that the element should be treated like a table column.

value.name: table-cell
value.description: Specifies that the element should be treated like a table cell.

value.name: table-caption
value.description: Specifies that the element should be treated like a table caption.

value.name: table
value.description: Specifies that the element should be treated like a table.

value.name: none
value.description: Specifies that the element should generate no boxes.

browser.description: Support on IE 5/6 is incomplete. Support is almost complete on IE 7, beta 3. Compatibility depends only on the values block, inline, none, inline-block, and list-item.
Support on Firefox is incomplete. Compatibility depends only on the values block, inline, none, inline-block, and list-item.

field.example:
For a demonstration of the display attribute and its values, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/display.html

field.name: font-size
field.description: Specifies either the explicit or relative size of the font compared to the base font size.

value.description: Specify a value for font-size that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

field.remarks: You can explicitly specify a font size for font-size in either pixels or a percentage.

field.name: font-size-adjust
field.description: Specifies the adjustment to make in font size if an explicitly specified font is unavailable.

field.name: font-stretch
field.description: Specifies how a font should be condensed or stretched.

field.name: font-style
field.description: Specifies a style for a font (e.g. italic).

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

field.name: font-variant
field.description: Specifies a variation for a font (e.g. small-caps).

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: small-caps
value.description: Small capital letters. Not supported in Safari.

field.name: font-weight
field.description: Specifies the weight of a font (e.g. bold).

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

field.name: height
field.description: Specifies the height (in pixels, points, or as a percentage) of the content of the element.

value.description: Specify a value for height that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Height to be determined by the window or parent element.

field.remarks: height does not include the margins, padding, or borders of an element.

field.name: ime-mode
field.description: Specifies the state of the Input Method Editor (IME) for the element, which allows users to enter and edit Chinese, Japanese, and Korean characters.

value.name: active
value.description: Enter all characters through the IME.

value.name: inactive
value.description: Do not enter characters through the IME, although the IME is still active.

field.name: layout-flow
field.description: Specifies the flow direction for the content of the element.

value.name: horizontal
value.description: Content flows from left to right.

value.name: vertical-ideographic
value.description: Content flows from top to bottom.

field.name: layout-grid
field.description: Defines the set of layout-grid properties for an element.

value.name: horizontal
value.description: Content flows from left to right.

value.name: vertical-ideographic
value.description: Content flows from top to bottom.

field.name: layout-grid-char
field.description: Specifies the size of a character grid for the content of an element.

value.description: Specify a value for layout-grid-char that is not on this list.

value.name: auto
value.description: Largest character in the font for the element content sets the grid size.

value.name: none
value.description: Character grid size is not set.

field.name: layout-grid-line
field.description: Specifies the grid line value for the text content of an element.

value.description: Specify a value for layout-grid-char that is not on this list.

value.name: auto
value.description: Largest character in the font for the element content sets the grid line.

value.name: none
value.description: Character grid line is not set.

field.name: layout-grid-mode
field.description: Specifies if the element text layout grid uses the line and/or char mode.

value.name: both
value.description: Use both the line and char mode.

value.name: line
value.description: Use a line grid. (Recommended for inline elements.)

value.name: char
value.description: Use a character grid. (Recommended for block elements.)

field.name: layout-grid-type
field.description: Specifies the type of layout grid for the content of an element.

value.name: loose
value.description: Use for Japanese and Korean characters.

value.name: strict
value.description: Use for Japanese (Genko), Chinese, and Korean characters.

field.name: left
field.description: Specifies the x-coordinate for the position of the element relative to the left edge of the parent element or browser window.

value.description: Specify a value for left that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Left edge position to be determined by the window or parent element.

field.remarks: You can also specify a fixed pixel or percentage value for left.

field.name: letter-spacing
field.description: Specifies the amount of space (in points or pixels) between letters in the text of the element.

value.description: Specify a value for letter-spacing that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

field.name: line-break
field.description: Specifies line-breaking rules for Japanese text.

field.name: line-height
field.description: Specifies line height of text in multiline elements, such as paragraphs.

value.description: Specify a value for line-height that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

field.remarks: You can also specify a fixed pixel or percentage value for line-height.

field.name: list-style
field.description: Defines the properties for the list style for a list element.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: inside
value.description: list-style-position: Place the bullet inside the left edge of the list.

value.name: outside
value.description: list-style-position: Place the bullet outside the left edge of the list.

value.name: decimal-leading-zero
value.description: list-style-type: Numbered list starting with a zero (e.g. 01., 02., 03., etc.)

value.name: lower-roman
value.description: list-style-type: Lower-case Roman numeral list (e.g. i., ii., iii., etc.)

value.name: upper-roman
value.description: list-style-type: Upper-case Roman numeral list (e.g. I., II., III., etc.)

value.name: lower-alpha
value.description: list-style-type: Lower-case alphabet list (e.g. a., b., c., etc.)

value.name: lower-latin
value.description: list-style-type: Lower-case alphabet list (e.g. a., b., c., etc.)

value.name: upper-alpha
value.description: list-style-type: Upper-case alphabet list (e.g. A., B., C., etc.)

value.name: upper-latin
value.description: list-style-type: Upper-case alphabet list (e.g. A., B., C., etc.)

field.remarks: Use the list-style property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual list-style properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a list-style property as part of list-style.

browser.description: Browser support incomplete in IE 5, 6, and 7.
Safari does not support the "box" style.

field.example:
To specify an unordered list with a square bullet outside of the list, use the following syntax: ul { list-style: square outside;}.

For a demonstration of the list-style-type attribute, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/lists.html

field.name: list-style-image
field.description: Specifies the URL to an image to use for list items.
field.example: To specify an unordered list that uses an image called "bluestar.gif" for a bullet, use the following syntax: ul { url(bluestar.gif)}.

field.name: list-style-position
field.description: Specifies the position of the bullet or number for a list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: inside
value.description: Place the bullet inside the left edge of the list.

value.name: outside
value.description: Place the bullet outside the left edge of the list.

field.name: list-style-type
field.description: Specifies the position of the bullet or number for a list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: decimal-leading-zero
value.description: Numbered list starting with a zero (e.g. 01., 02., 03., etc.)

value.name: lower-roman
value.description: Lower-case Roman numeral list (e.g. i., ii., iii., etc.)

value.name: upper-roman
value.description: Upper-case Roman numeral list (e.g. I., II., III., etc.)

value.name: lower-alpha
value.description: Lower-case alphabet list (e.g. a., b., c., etc.)

value.name: lower-latin
value.description: Lower-case alphabet list (e.g. a., b., c., etc.)

value.name: upper-alpha
value.description: Upper-case alphabet list (e.g. A., B., C., etc.)

value.name: upper-latin
value.description: Upper-case alphabet list (e.g. A., B., C., etc.)

browser.description: Browser support incomplete in IE 5, 6, and 7.
Safari does not support the "box" style.

field.example:
For a demonstration of the list-style-type attribute, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/lists.html

field.name: margin
field.description: Defines the widths (in pixels, points, or a percentage) for the margins for the element.
field.remarks:
Use the margin property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual margin properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a margin property as part of margin.

You can specify up to four different widths for the margin of an element.

  • For a margin that is the same on all four sides, specify a single value.
  • For a margin that is different on the top/bottom and left/right sides, specify two values with the top/bottom value first.
  • For a margin that is different on the top, left/right, and bottom sides, specify three values with the top value first, followed by the left/right and then bottom values.
  • For a margin with four different widths, specify four values in the order of top, right, bottom, and left.
field.example: To specify a margin that is 10px wide on the top and left and 5px wide on the bottom and right, use the following syntax: body {margin: 10px 5px 5px 10px;}.

field.name: margin-bottom
field.description: Specifies the width (in pixels, points, or a percentage) for the bottom margin of an element.

field.name: margin-left
field.description: Specifies the width (in pixels, points, or a percentage) for the left margin of an element.

field.name: margin-right
field.description: Specifies the width (in pixels, points, or a percentage) for the right margin of an element.

field.name: margin-top
field.description: Specifies the width (in pixels, points, or a percentage) for the top margin of an element.

field.name: marker-offset
field.description: Specifies the width (in pixels or points) between the marker box of an element and the surrounding box of its parent element.

field.name: marks
field.description: Specifies if cross or crop marks should appear outside of the element on a printed page.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: crop
value.description: Display crop marks (for cutting the page).

value.name: cross
value.description: Display cross marks (for aligning the page).

field.name: max-height
field.description: Specifies the maximum height that an element may be.
field.remarks: This property is useful for elements that are relatively sized compared to a browser window or parent element.

browser.description: Minimal support in IE 6.

field.example:
For a demonstration of the min and max height and width attributes, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/width.html

field.name: max-width
field.description: Specifies the maximum width that an element may be.
field.remarks: This property is useful for elements that are relatively sized compared to a browser window or parent element.

browser.description: Minimal support in IE 6.

field.example:

field.name: min-height
field.description: Specifies the minimum height that an element may be.
field.remarks: This property is useful for elements that are relatively sized compared to a browser window or parent element.

browser.description: Minimal support in IE 6. min-height only supported on TD.

field.example:
For a demonstration of the min and max height and width attributes, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/width.html

field.name: min-width
field.description: Specifies the minimum width that an element may be.
field.remarks: This property is useful for elements that are relatively sized compared to a browser window or parent element.

browser.description: Minimal support in IE 6.
