field.name: -moz-binding
field.description: Specifies the URL of an XBL file to bind to the element.

field.name: -moz-border-radius
field.description: Specifies the radius of the border around the element.
field.remarks:
Use the border-style property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual -moz-border-radius properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a border-style- property as part of border-style.

You can specify up to four different border styles for the border of an element.

  • For a border radius that is the same on all four corners, specify a single value.
  • For a border radius that is different on the top-left/bottom-right and top-right/bottom-left corners, specify two values with the top-left/bottom-right value first.
  • For a border radius that are different on the top-left, top-rightright/bottom-left, and bottom-right corners, specify three values in the order of top-left, top-rightright/bottom-left, and bottom-right.
  • For a border radius with four different corners, specify four values in the order of top-left, top-rightright, bottom-right, and bottom-left.

field.name: -moz-border-radius-bottomleft
field.description: Specifies the border radius of the bottom-left corner of the element.

field.name: -moz-border-radius-bottomright
field.description: Specifies the border radius of the bottom-right corner of the element.

field.name: -moz-border-radius-topleft
field.description: Specifies the border radius of the top-left corner of the element.

field.name: -moz-border-radius-topright
field.description: Specifies the border radius of the top-right corner of the element.

field.name: -moz-border-top-colors
field.description: Specifies one or more colors to use in a striping effect on the top border of the element.
field.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

field.name: -moz-border-right-colors
field.description: Specifies one or more colors to use in a striping effect on the right border of the element.
field.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

field.name: -moz-border-bottom-colors
field.description: Specifies one or more colors to use in a striping effect on the bottom border of the element.
field.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

field.name: -moz-border-left-colors
field.description: Specifies one or more colors to use in a striping effect on the left border of the element.
field.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

field.name: -moz-opacity
field.description: Specifies the level of opacity for the element. Use a two-digit decimal.
field.hint: [0-1.0] 0 is completely transparent, while 1.0 is completely solid.

field.name: -moz-outline
field.description: Mozilla-specific version of the outline property. Defines the properties for an outline drawn over the outer edge of an element.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

field.name: -moz-outline-color
field.description: Mozilla-specific version of the outline-color property that specifies the color for an outline. Specify either a color name or RGB color code.
field.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

field.name: -moz-outline-style
field.description: Mozilla-specific version of the outline-style property that specifies a style for an outline.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

field.name: -moz-outline-width
field.description: Mozilla-specific version of the outline-width property that specifies the width of the outline.

value.description: Specify an outline width value not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

field.name: -moz-user-focus
field.description: Specifies the behavior of the element when it receives focus.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

field.name: -moz-user-input
field.description: Specifies whether or not the element has input focus.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: none
value.description: Element is neither enabled or disabled for user input.

value.name: enabled
value.description: Element is enabled for user input.

value.name: disabled
value.description: Element is disabled for user input.

field.name: -moz-user-modify
field.description: Specifies if a user can change the contents of the element.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: write-only
value.description: Element contents are write-only. (e.g. Password field)

field.name: -moz-user-select
field.description: Specifies the content selection behavior for the element.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: none
value.description: Content of the element cannot be selected.

value.name: text
value.description: Text content of the element can be selected.

value.name: element
value.description: One element at a time can be selected.

value.name: all
value.description: Contents of the element are selected as a whole.

value.name: toggle
value.description: Contents of the element are selected via the text selection toggling model.

value.name: tri-state
value.description: Contents are selected via three-state selection model.

field.name: -o-link
field.description: Specifies the value for the link variable.

field.name: -o-link-source
field.description: Specifies the source anchor for the element.

field.name: opacity
field.description: Specifies the transparency of an element. Specify a value between 0.0-1.0.

browser.description: For IE, specify a whole number percentage (e.g. "50" for 50%) instead of the standard fraction syntax.

field.example:
For a demonstration of the opacity attribute for table columns, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/opacity.html
field.remarks: Available in CSS3 according to W3C standards.

field.name: orphans
field.description: Specifies the minimum number of lines of text that an element must have left at the bottom of a page for printing.

field.name: outline
field.description: Defines the properties for an outline drawn over the outer edge of an element. Outlines differ from borders in that borders are drawn to the outside of the element.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

browser.description: Support for "outline" in Safari is "buggy".

field.remarks: Use the outline property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual outline properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a outline property as part of outline.
field.example:
To specify a thick, red, dashed outline, use the following syntax: .myoutlineclass {outline: thick red dashed;}.

For a demonstration of the outline attributes, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/outline.html

field.name: outline-color
field.description: Specifies the color for an outline. Specify either a color name or RGB color code.
field.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

browser.description: Support for "outline" in Safari is "buggy".

field.example:
For a demonstration of the outline attributes, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/outline.html

field.name: outline-style
field.description: Specifies a style for an outline.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

browser.description: Support for "outline" in Safari is "buggy".

field.example:
For a demonstration of the outline attributes, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/outline.html

field.name: outline-width
field.description: Specifies the width of the outline.

value.description: Specify an outline width value not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

browser.description: Support for "outline" in Safari is "buggy".

field.remarks: You can also specify a fixed pixel value for outline-width.
field.example:
For a demonstration of the outline attributes, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/outline.html

field.name: overflow
field.description: Specifies how to handle content overflow of an element if the content does not fit within the predefined boundaries of the element.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: visible
value.description: Content is rendered outside of the element.

value.name: hidden
value.description: Content is clipped at the boundaries of the element.

value.name: scroll
value.description: Display scroll bars to access overflow content.

value.name: auto
value.description: Overflow behavior to be determined by the window or user settings.

browser.description: Support for overflow is almost complete for IE 5-6
Support for overflow is not dynamic.

field.example:
For a demonstration of the overflow attribute, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/overflow.html

field.name: overflow-x
field.description: Specifies how to handle content overflow of an element if the content is too wide for the element.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: visible
value.description: Content is rendered outside of the element.

value.name: hidden
value.description: Content is clipped at the boundaries of the element.

value.name: scroll
value.description: Display scroll bars to access overflow content.

value.name: auto
value.description: Overflow behavior to be determined by the window or user settings.

field.name: overflow-y
field.description: Specifies how to handle content overflow of an element if the content is too tall for the element.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: visible
value.description: Content is rendered outside of the element.

value.name: hidden
value.description: Content is clipped at the boundaries of the element.

value.name: scroll
value.description: Display scroll bars to access overflow content.

value.name: auto
value.description: Overflow behavior to be determined by the window or user settings.

field.name: padding
field.description: Specifies the amount of padding space between the content of an element and its border.
field.remarks:
Use the padding property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual padding properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a padding property as part of padding.

You can specify up to four different widths for the amound of padding for an element.

  • For padding that is the same on all four sides, specify a single value.
  • For padding that is different on the top/bottom and left/right sides, specify two values with the top/bottom value first.
  • For padding that is different on the top, left/right, and bottom sides, specify three values with the top value first, followed by the left/right and then bottom values.
  • For padding with four different widths, specify four values in the order of top, right, bottom, and left.
field.example: To specify a padding that is 10px wide on the top and left and 5px wide on the bottom and right, use the following syntax: body {padding: 10px 5px 5px 10px;}.

field.name: padding-bottom
field.description: Specifies the amount of padding (in pixels, points, or a percentage) at the bottom of an element.

field.name: padding-left
field.description: Specifies the amount of padding (in pixels, points, or a percentage) for the left side of an element.

field.name: padding-right
field.description: Specifies the amount of padding (in pixels, points, or a percentage) for the right side of an element.

field.name: padding-top
field.description: Specifies the amount of padding (in pixels, points, or a percentage) at the top of an element.

field.name: page
field.description: Specifies the type of page that the element should be displayed on.

field.name: page-break-after
field.description: Defines the way that a page breaks after the element when the page is printed.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Page break behavior to be determined by the user or window settings.

value.name: always
value.description: Always insert a page break after the element.

value.name: avoid
value.description: Avoid a page break after the element.

value.name: left
value.description: Page break to a left page (e.g. like in a book) after the element.

value.name: right
value.description: Page break to a right page (e.g. like in a book) after the element.

field.name: page-break-before
field.description: Defines the way that a page breaks before the element when the page is printed.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Page break behavior to be determined by the user or window settings.

value.name: always
value.description: Always insert a page break before the element.

value.name: avoid
value.description: Avoid a page break before the element.

value.name: left
value.description: Page break to a left page (e.g. like in a book) before the element.

value.name: right
value.description: Page break to a right page (e.g. like in a book) before the element.

field.name: page-break-inside
field.description: Specifies if an element should have a page break forced inside of the element or if page breaks should be avoided inside the element when the page is printed.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: avoid
value.description: Avoid a page break inside the element.

value.name: always
value.description: Always insert a page break inside the element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Page break behavior to be determined by the user or window settings.

field.name: pause
field.description: Specifies the number of seconds or milliseconds to pause before and/or after an element before playing audio content.
field.remarks: Use the pause property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual pause properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a pause property as part of pause.

field.name: pause-after
field.description: Specifies the number of seconds or milliseconds to pause after an element before playing audio content.

field.name: pause-before
field.description: Specifies the number of seconds or milliseconds to pause before an element before playing audio content.

field.name: pitch
field.description: Specifies the frequency of a speaking voice for audio content.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

field.name: pitch-range
field.description: Specifies the range of the pitch of a speaking voice for audio content.

field.name: play-during
field.description: Specifies a sound to play while the content of the element is being spoken.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: mix
value.description: Mix the sound from the element with the sound from the parent element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Continue to play the sound of the parent element.

field.name: position
field.description: Specifies how the element is positioned relative to the page or other elements.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: static
value.description: Position the element in the order that it occurs in the document.

value.name: relative
value.description: Position the element with offsets relative to the document flow.

value.name: absolute
value.description: Position the element at the specified coordinates.

value.name: fixed
value.description: Position the element in a fixed position as the page scrolls.

browser.description: IE 6 does not support position:fixed.

field.example:
For a demonstration of the position attribute, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/position.html

field.name: quotes
field.description: Specifies the style of quotation marks to use for embedded quotes.

field.name: richness
field.description: Specifies the richness of the speaking voice for audio content.

field.name: right
field.description: Specifies the x-coordinate for the position of the element relative to the right edge of the parent element or browser window.

value.description: Specify a value for right that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Right edge of the element should be determined by the window or parent element.

field.remarks: You can also specify a fixed pixel or percentage value for right.

field.name: ruby-align
field.description: Specifies the alignment for ruby text.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: left
value.description: Ruby text is left-aligned with base.

value.name: center
value.description: Ruby text is center-aligned with base.

value.name: right
value.description: Ruby text is right-aligned with base.

value.name: distribute-letter
value.description: Distribute evenly based on the letters of ruby text content.

value.name: distribute-space
value.description: Distrute evenly based on the space of the ruby text content.

value.name: line-edge
value.description: Center ruby text if it is not adjacent to a line edge.

field.name: ruby-overhang
field.description: Specifies the overhang of ruby text.

value.name: auto
value.description: Ruby text overhangs any text adjacent to the base text.

value.name: whitespace
value.description: Ruby text only overhangs whitespace characters.

value.name: none
value.description: Ruby text only overhangs text adjacent to its base.

field.name: ruby-position
field.description: Specifies the position of ruby text.

value.name: above
value.description: Ruby text is positioned above the base text.

value.name: inline
value.description: Ruby text is positioned inline with the base text.

field.name: scrollbar-3dlight-color
field.description: Specifies the color of the top and left edges of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.
field.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

field.name: scrollbar-arrow-color
field.description: Specifies the color of the arrow of a scroll bar.
field.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

field.name: scrollbar-base-color
field.description: Specifies the color of the main elements of a scroll bar.
field.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

field.name: scrollbar-darkshadow-color
field.description: Specifies the color of the gutter of a scroll bar.
field.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

field.name: scrollbar-face-color
field.description: Specifies the color of the scroll box and arrows of a scroll bar.
field.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

field.name: scrollbar-highlight-color
field.description: Specifies the color of the top and left edges of the scroll box and arrows of a scroll bar.
field.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

field.name: scrollbar-shadow-color
field.description: Specifies the color of the bottom and right edges of the scroll box and arrows of a scroll bar.
field.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

field.name: scrollbar-track-color
field.description: Specifies the color of the track element of a scroll bar.
field.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

field.name: size
field.description: Specifies the size and orientation of a page for print output.
field.hint: [width] [height] [size-value]. Example values: 8.5in 10in portrait, 14 in 10 in, landscape, etc.

value.description: Specify a value for size that is not on this list.

value.name: auto
value.description: Page size to be determined by window or user settings.

field.example: To specify an 10x8 inch page that prints as landscape, use the following syntax: body {size: landscape 10in 8in;}.

field.name: speak
field.description: Specifies how the content will be rendered as audio content.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: normal
value.description: Render the content according to its language.

value.name: spell-out
value.description: Spell out each letter of the text for the content.

field.name: speak-header
field.description: For audio content, specifies whether table headers are spoken before every cell or just once until the header changes.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: once
value.description: Speak the name of the header once.

value.name: always
value.description: Speak the name of the header before each associated cell.

field.name: speak-numeral
field.description: For audio content, specifies whether numerals are spoken as individual digits or continuous numbers.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: digits
value.description: Speak the digits of a number individually (e.g. 'one-three').

value.name: continuous
value.description: Speak the digits as a continuous number (e.g. 'thirteen').

field.name: speak-punctuation
field.description: For audio content, specifies whether punctuation characters will be spoken or read as pauses.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: code
value.description: Speak the name of each punction mark (e.g. Say the word, 'period' at the end of a sentence.

field.name: speech-rate
field.description: For audio content, specifies the speaking rate.

value.description: Specify a value for speech-rate that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

field.name: stress
field.description: For audio content, specifies the number of inflection points in the voice.

field.name: table-layout
field.description: Specifies whether the layout of table rows, columns, and cells is fixed.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Use the standard table layout rendering.

value.name: fixed
value.description: Render the table layout in a single pass.

browser.description: table-layout is not supported in IE on a Mac.

field.example:
For a demonstration of the table-layout attribute, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/tables.html#tablelayout

field.name: text-align
field.description: Specifies the horizontal alignment property for the element.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: left
value.description: Align the text at the left edge.

value.name: right
value.description: Align the text at the right edge.

value.name: center
value.description: Align the text at the center of the element.

field.name: text-align-last
field.description: Specifies the alignment for the last or only line of text for the element.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: left
value.description: Align the text at the left edge.

value.name: right
value.description: Align the text at the right edge.

value.name: center
value.description: Align the text at the center of the element.

field.name: text-decoration
field.description: Specifies a text decoration for the element.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: overline
value.description: Draw a line over the text.

value.name: line-through
value.description: Draw a line through the text (i.e. strikethrough).

field.name: text-indent
field.description: Specifies the amount (in pixels, points, or a percentage) that the first line of text should be indented in a block of content.

field.name: text-justify
field.description: Specifies the alignment to use to justify the text for the element.

value.name: distribute
value.description: Increases or decreases letter spacing between words. Optomized for Asian languages.

value.name: distribute-all-lines
value.description: Same as distribute, but also justifies last line in a paragraph.

value.name: inter-cluster
value.description: Justifies lines of text with no inter-word spacing.

value.name: inter-ideograph
value.description: Justifies lines of ideograph text, including both inter-ideograph and inter-word spacing.

value.name: inter-word
value.description: Justifies lines of text based on spacing between words.

value.name: kashida
value.description: Justifies lines of text by elongating characters.

value.name: newspaper
value.description: Increases or decreases letter spacing between words.

field.name: text-overflow
field.description: Specifies whether to use ellipses (...) to indicate text overflow.

field.name: text-shadow
field.description: Defines the horizontal depth, vertical depth, blur, and color for a drop-shadow for text content in the element.
field.remarks: Specify the color before or after the depth and blur values. The first depth value corresponds to the number of pixels the shandow extends to the right. The second depth value corresponds to the number of pixels the shadow extends below the text. A third value corresponds to blur.
field.example: To specify a blue 5 pixel drop-shadow with a 5 pixel blur, use the following syntax: H1 {text-shadow: 5px 5px 5px blue;}.

field.name: text-transform
field.description: Specifies that the text for the element should be converted to the assigned case or format.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: capitalize
value.description: Capitalize the first letter of every word.

value.name: uppercase
value.description: Capitalize every letter of every word.

field.name: text-underline-position
field.description: Specifies the position of the underline text-decoration.

value.name: auto
value.description: Underline appears in the appropriate position for the language of the element.

field.name: top
field.description: Specifies the y-coordinate for the position of the element relative to the top edge of the parent element or browser window.

value.description: Specify a value for top that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Top position to be determined by the window or parent element.

field.remarks: You can also specify a fixed pixel or percentage value for top.

field.name: unicode-bidi
field.description: Specifies that the text direction in the element may be overriden for multi-language support.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: embed
value.description: A new level of embedding may change direction.

value.name: bidi-override
value.description: The direction property may override a pre-defined direction.

field.name: vertical-align
field.description: Specifies the vertical alignment property for the element.

value.description: Specify a value for vertical-align that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: baseline
value.description: Align with the baseline of the containing element.

value.name: top
value.description: Align with the top of the tallest element.

value.name: text-top
value.description: Align with the top of the text of the containing element.

value.name: middle
value.description: Align with the middle of the containing element.

value.name: text-bottom
value.description: Align with the bottom of the text of the containing element.

field.remarks: You can also specify a fixed pixel or percentage value for vertical-align.

field.name: visibility
field.description: Specifies whether an element is visible or hidden.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

browser.description: Supports only the "hidden" for table columns.
Supports only the "collapse" for table columns.

field.remarks: The visibility attribute is not well-supported for table columns in some browsers.
field.example:
For additional information and a demonstration of the visibility attribute for table columns, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/columns.html#visibility

field.name: voice-family
field.description: Specifies the speaking voice for audio content.
field.hint: [voice-name | voice-family-value]. Example values: george, robot, male, etc.

value.description: Specify a specific voice name not on this list.

field.remarks: You can specify a specific voice name and/or a male, female, or child voice.

field.name: volume
field.description: Specifies the sound volume for audio content.
field.hint: [0-100 | percentage | volume-value]. Example values: 25, 30%, soft, etc.

value.description: Specify a value for volume that is not on this list.

field.remarks: You can specify a number from 0-100 or a percentage to set the volume for this property.

field.name: white-space
field.description: Specifies how to handle white space characters for the element.

value.name: nowrap
value.description: Collapse whitespace unless specified otherwise by an appropriate tag (e.g. br).

value.name: pre-wrap
value.description: Prevents user agents from collapsing sequences of whitespace.

value.name: pre-line
value.description: User agents should collapse sequences of whitespace.

browser.description: IE only supports the "pre" value for white-space.
Support for white-space is incomplete.
Opera almost has full support for the white-space attribute.
Support for white-space is incomplete.

field.example:
For a demonstration of the white-space attribute for table columns, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/whitespace.html

field.name: widows
field.description: Specifies the minimum number of lines of text that an element must have left at the top of a page for printing.

field.name: width
field.description: Specifies the width (in pixels, points, or as a percentage) of the content of the element.

value.description: Specify a value for width that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Width to be determined by the window or parent element.

field.example:
For additional information and a demonstration of the width attribute, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/columns.html#width
field.remarks: width does not include the margins, padding, or borders of an element.

field.name: word-break
field.description: Specifies line-breaking behavior between words in the content of the element.

value.name: break-all
value.description: Allows arbitrary line-breaking within words for non-Asian text. Same as 'normal' for Asian text.

value.name: keep-all
value.description: Does not allow line-breaking for Japanese, Chinese, and Korean text.

field.name: word-spacing
field.description: Specifies the amount of space between words for the element text.

field.name: word-wrap
field.description: Specifies line-breaking behavior for words that are longer than their container boundaries.

value.name: normal
value.description: Allows content to be rendered outside of its container.

value.name: break-word
value.description: Allows word-breaks for content to wrap to the next line, if necessary.

field.name: writing-mode
field.description: Specifies the direction and flow of content in the element.

value.name: lr-tb
value.description: Text flows left to right and top to bottom.

value.name: tb-rl
value.description: Text flows top to bottom and right to left, by columns.

field.name: z-index
field.description: Specifies the stacking order of the element relative to other layers. A higher z-index value will place the element above layers with lower z-index values.

field.name: zoom
field.description: Specifies the magnification scale for the element.

value.description: Specify a value for zoom that is not on this list.
